Class: TurtleComponent

TurtleComponent(props)

Represents a Turtle Component.

Constructor

new TurtleComponent(props)

Creates an instance of TurtleComponent.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
props Object

The properties passed to the component.

Classes

TurtleComponent

Members

refs

Gets the references from the render context.

Methods

_reactive(commit)

Handles reactivity for state changes.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
commit Object

The commit object representing state changes.

createState(name, value) → {TurtleComponentState}

Creates a new state for the component.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
name string

The name of the state.
value *

The initial value of the state.
Returns:

The created state object.

Type
TurtleComponentState

getContext(name) → {TurtleContext}

Retrieves a context by name.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
name string

The name of the context.
Returns:

The requested context instance.

Type
TurtleContext

getState(name) → {*}

Gets the value of a specific state.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
name string

The name of the state.
Returns:

The value of the state.

Type
*

html(raw, …values) → {DocumentFragment}

Creates a fragment using a template literal and values.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
raw TemplateStringsArray

The raw template literal.
values * <repeatable>

The values to be used in the template.
Returns:

The rendered HTML as a DocumentFragment.

Type
DocumentFragment

initStates(states)

Initializes the states for the component.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
states Object

An object containing state names and initial values.

onCreate()

Lifecycle method called when the component is created. Should be overridden by subclasses.

onDestroy()

Lifecycle method called when the component is destroyed. Should be overridden by subclasses.

onInit()

Lifecycle method called when the component is initialized. Should be overridden by subclasses.

onRender()

Lifecycle method called after the component is rendered. Should be overridden by subclasses.

onUpdate(commit)

Lifecycle method called when the component is updated. Should be overridden by subclasses.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
commit Object

The commit object representing state changes.

(async) requestRender() → {Promise.<void>}

Requests a render for the component using its template.

Returns:
Type
Promise.<void>

(async) requestUpdate(commit) → {Promise.<void>}

Requests an update for the component and triggers the onUpdate lifecycle method.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
commit Object

The commit object representing state changes.
Returns:
Type
Promise.<void>

setState(name, value)

Sets the state of the component.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
name string

The name of the state.
value *

The new value of the state.

setupForwardRef() → {Object}

Sets up forward references for the component. Should be overridden by subclasses.

Returns:

An object containing forward references.

Type
Object

setupState() → {Object}

Sets up the initial states for the component. Should be overridden by subclasses.

Returns:

An object containing initial state values.

Type
Object

setupWatcher() → {Object}

Sets up watchers for the component. Should be overridden by subclasses.

Returns:

An object containing watcher functions.

Type
Object

start()

Starts the component by setting up forward references, watchers, and states, then requests a render.

state(name) → {TurtleComponentState}

Gets the state object by its name.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
name string

The name of the state.
Returns:

The state object.

Type
TurtleComponentState

template() → {DocumentFragment}

Returns the template of the component. Should be overridden by subclasses.

Returns:

The template as a DocumentFragment.

Type
DocumentFragment

useContext(name, context)

Registers a context for use within the component.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
name string

The name of the context.
context TurtleContext

The context instance.
Throws:

Throws an error if the context is not an instance of TurtleContext.

Type
Error
